newsitem.title: USA: SOCCER-BRANCO OF 1994 WORLD CUP FAME, TO PLAY FOR METRO STARS.
newsitem.headline: SOCCER-BRANCO OF 1994 WORLD CUP FAME, TO PLAY FOR METRO STARS.

text.p: Brazilian defender Branco, who played in the last three World Cups, signed a contract with Major League Soccer on Sunday and was assigned to the New York/New Jersey Metro Stars for the rest of the season.
Branco, 33, whose full name is Claudio Ibraim Vaz Leal, is expected to make his debut against D.C. United next Sunday, if the league can have his visa approved in time.
Branco is probably best known for his 35-yard free kick that lifted Brazil to a 3-2 victory over The Netherlands in the 81st minute of the World Cup quarterfinals in 1994.
"It's a new challenge for me," Branco said. "I have played in many different leagues and have gained valuable experience. It's a new experience, so I will learn something here too."
Branco has played in the top leagues of Italy, Britain, Portugal and Brazil, but has not played competitively for two months.

"I have known Branco since he is 19 years old and I believe he would be a great player for the Metro Stars and the league," Metro Stars' coach Carlos Alberto Parreira said. "His experience would go a long way in helping the young American players."
